snippet: BEIJING - The Chongqing leader's downfall points to perhaps the most serious division in the party elite since the leadership upheavals during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests. To incumbent leaders who worried about Mr. Bo's destabilizing impact,...
abstract: BEIJING - The Chongqing leader's downfall points to perhaps the most serious division in the party elite since the leadership upheavals during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests. To incumbent leaders who worried about Mr. Bo's destabilizing impact, "the Wang Lijun case was just a godsend," said an expert. Read the full article »

headline.main: Bo Xilai's Ouster Exposes Ideological Divisions in China's Ruling Party
